intro: Crabbea undulatifolia, commonly known as the undulating leaf crabbea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features broad, undulating leaves that are typically evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Crabbea undulatifolia is also known for its ability to produce multiple blooms throughout the growing season.
